label: A
text: Definitions applicable to the Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act (VCDPA), including Consumer, Controller, Processor, Personal Data, Sensitive Data, and other key terms.

label: A
text: Scope of the VCDPA - applies to controllers and processors processing personal data of Virginia residents and meeting applicable thresholds.

label: B
text: Exemptions from VCDPA - government functions, HIPAA covered entities, GLBA regulated entities, and other specified exemptions.

label: A
text: Consumer rights under VCDPA - right to confirm and access, correct, delete, obtain portability, and opt out of targeted advertising, sale, and profiling.

label: B
text: Exercise of rights - consumers may submit authenticated requests; controllers must respond within 45 days, extendable to 90 days.

label: C
text: Appeals process - consumers may appeal a refusal or partial fulfillment of a rights request.

label: A
text: Controller duties regarding security - establish, implement, and maintain reasonable administrative, technical, and physical data security practices.

label: B
text: Controller duties regarding notice - provide clear, reasonably accessible privacy notice at or before collection of personal data.

label: C
text: Privacy notice content - must disclose categories of personal data, purposes, rights exercise methods, data sharing, and opt-out mechanisms.

label: A
text: Processor requirements - must process personal data only on instructions from the controller and for limited purposes.

label: B
text: Data processing agreement - required contract between controller and processor with specified mandatory terms.

label: A
text: Data Protection Assessment (DPA) requirement - controllers must conduct DPA for targeted advertising, sales, profiling, and sensitive data processing.

label: B
text: DPA content - must assess benefits and risks of processing, consider alternatives, and document findings.

label: A
text: Enforcement authority - Virginia Attorney General has exclusive enforcement power under VCDPA.

label: B
text: Cure period - 30-day mandatory period for controllers to remedy violations after receiving notice from Attorney General.

label: C
text: Civil penalties - up to $7,500 per violation for uncured or continued violations of VCDPA.
